alert.note: Alert for Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 10 at 2:07AM EST until January 12 at 2:30AM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast New York, including the following counties, Nassau and Suffolk. * WHEN...Until 515 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 205 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rain. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Flooding impacts will continue through this morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Islip, Brentwood, Levittown, Freeport, Valley Stream, Commack, Huntington Station, Centereach, Shirley, Deer Park, Lindenhurst, Plainview, Medford, Garden City, Massapequa, Hauppauge, Lynbrook, Ronkonkoma, Syosset and Mineola. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
